result.execSummary:
The defendant Lindsey Dawayne Neal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already done.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge due on 12-31-2015. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: To any sentence; release to the Day Reporting Center, medical treatment, and any Alcohol and Drug assessment treatment; credit for 0 days time served. Court does not object to electronic monitoring.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lindsey Dawayne Neal

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lindsey Dawayne Neal in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Lindsey Dawayne Neal in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
Court ordered defendant to serve 21 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for the Day Reporting Center, medical treatment, and any Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment; credit for 0 days time served. Court does not object to electronic monitoring. 
- Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already done. 
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge due on 12-31-2015. Any remaining balance will become immediately dueor civil judgment to be entered. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Lindsey Dawayne Neal not in court, in custody.  Paul Hauer for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. Case held ff the record. Case has been administratively transferred from Attorney Scholle to Attorney Carpenter. For the reasons presented to the Court the case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 2-18-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary D. Scholle in court, defendant Lindsey Dawayne Neal not in court, in custody.  Paul Hauer for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea and Sentencing.  Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing on 2-5-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lindsey Dawayne Neal in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Lindsey Dawayne Neal in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Defendant Lindsey Dawayne Neal in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge STARK, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
